SEARCH
Package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service

Class UserRepository

java.lang.Object
edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service.UserRepository
@Singleton public class UserRepository extends Object
Provides high-level operations on a repository of User instances, backed by a SQLite database, in turn accessed via TeamleDatabase. This class has no mutable state, and its methods are thread-safe; however, mutating operations (involving INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE on the underlying database) attempted simultaneously could block or fail.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrent

      public Single<User> getCurrent()
      Constructs and returns a Single that, when executed (subscribed to), retrieves the User instance for the current signed-in user from the database, and passes it to the subscribing Consumer.

    • get

      public LiveData<User> get(long id)
      Returns a LiveData-based query for the User entity instance identified by id. The query executes when observed, or (if already being observed) whenever the contents of the underlying user table are modified using Room data-access methods.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier (primary key value) of a User entity instance.
      Returns:
      LiveData-based query for the User identified by id.

    • getAll

      public LiveData<List<User>> getAll()
      Returns a LiveData-based query of all User entity instances. The query executes when observed, or (if already being observed) whenever the contents of the underlying user table are modified using Room data-access methods.

    • save

      public Single<User> save(User user)
      Constructs and returns a Single task that, when executed (subscribed to), will insert or update the specified user in the database, and pass the updated User instance to the subscribing Consumer. The specific persistence operation is determined by examining the value returned by User.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the user has not yet been INSERTed and must be; a non-zero value indicates that user is already in the database, and must thus be UPDATEd.
      Parameters:
      user - Instance of User entity class to be persisted (inserted or updated) in the database.
      Returns:
      Single task that will persist user to the database when executed (subscribed to).

    • delete

      public Completable delete(User user)
      Constructs and returns a Completable task that, when executed (subscribed to), will remove the specified user from the database, if present, and invoke the subscribing Action on completion. Whether the deletion is even necessary is determined by examining the value returned by User.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the user has not been inserted into the database, and thus need not be deleted; a non-zero value indicates that user is in the database and must be DELETEd.

      If an attempt is made to delete the User entity instance corresponding to the current signed-in user, the Completable will fail, with an IllegalStateException passed to the Consumer<Throwable> specified in Completable.subscribe(Action, Consumer, DisposableContainer).

      Parameters:
      user - Instance of User entity class to be deleted from the database.
      Returns:
      Completable task that will delete user from the database when executed (subscribed to).
